text.text_translated:
It is not possible to know the future of street art. But some new things are happening.

Most street artists are young people. They paint in their city or their area. But now, more artists travel around the world. They work in different countries.

Other artists use the internet. They talk to each other. They also share photos of their art.

The art world is changing. People now think street art is real art. We do not know what will happen in the future. But we know street art will not go away.

feedback.feedback:
PASS: The text is an exemplary model of A2 simplification.

- Factual Integrity: The output is factually identical to the original text.
- Metrics Compliance: MeaningBERT (0.83) and BERTScore (0.93) are well above the required thresholds, confirming excellent preservation of meaning and key terms.
- CEFR Compliance: The A2 classification is correct. The text avoids all B1 complexity.
- Qualitative Audit: The vocabulary is strictly within the A1/A2 range. Complex sentence structures from the original text, such as those using 'While' and 'Although', have been expertly deconstructed into short, simple sentences appropriate for the A2 level. The simplification of concepts like 'legitimate art form' to 'real art' is precise and effective. No deviations from the standard were detected.

best_attempt.text_translated:
It is not possible to know the future of street art. But some new things are happening.

Most street artists are young people. They paint in their city or their area. But now, more artists travel around the world. They work in different countries.

Other artists use the internet. They talk to each other. They also share photos of their art.

The art world is changing. People now think street art is real art. We do not know what will happen in the future. But we know street art will not go away.
